DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Methylation Site CpG Dinucleotide Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The status related to the methylation of CpG sites, a dinucleotide consisting of cytosine followed by guanine.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the methylation of CpG sites, a dinucleotide consisting of cytosine followed by guanine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sequence in DNA that can be recognized by a specific methylase enzyme and that contains the specific base target for methyl transfer.:A dinucleotide consisting of cytosine followed by guanine.

Concepts.definition: A sequence in DNA that can be recognized by a specific methylase enzyme and that contains the specific base target for methyl transfer.
A dinucleotide consisting of cytosine followed by guanine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Percent Unit Methylation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Percent Unit Methylation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: The attachment of a methyl group to a molecule. Usually refers to DNA methylation. The expression level of a gene is often regulated by its methylation state; expressed genes are usually hypomethylated. C0025723: Methylation

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
The covalent chemical or biochemical addition of a methyl group(s) to a compound. (NCI)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than Twenty Percent Unit Methylation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than Twenty Percent Unit Methylation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: The attachment of a methyl group to a molecule. Usually refers to DNA methylation. The expression level of a gene is often regulated by its methylation state; expressed genes are usually hypomethylated. C0025723: Methylation

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
The covalent chemical or biochemical addition of a methyl group(s) to a compound. (NCI)
